description.narrative: The project consists of a direct equity investment of up to RUB 2.90 billion in CREDIT BANK OF MOSCOW (CBM), a medium-sized universal bank, well known to IFC from earlier projects. CBM was established in Moscow in 1992 and now ranks among the top-25 banks of Russia in terms of assets. CBM operates in Moscow and the Moscow region, offering both corporate and retail banking services to a wide range of clients. The main purpose of the project is to improve access to finance for clients of the Bank, mainly represented by mid-sized companies and to strengthen the capital of the bank in view of its regional expansion and its preparation for an initial public offering (IPO) in the mid-term.

The proposed investment seeks to (i) help Credit Bank of Moscow grow and serve its small-and-medium enterprise client base; (ii) expand its operations to new regions outside of Moscow; (iii) strengthen and diversify its capital base; (iv) mobilize additional investors to enter the Bank''s capital in light of a future initial public offering (IPO); and (v) promote best practices in terms of corporate governance and business and risk management, enabling the Bank to become one of the key platforms for sector consolidation.

name.narrative: CREDIT BANK OF MOSCOW is headquartered in Moscow and operates in Moscow and the Moscow region. The Banks network consists of approximately 60 branches, 14 cash offices, 600 ATMs, and over 4,000 payment terminals. CBMs clients are well diversified, ranging from small local retailers to larger companies operating nationwide. Investments can be made throughout the country.
